snippet: Charges and countercharges flew over the veracity of allegations that Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey had patronized prostitutes in the Dominican Republic.
abstract: Dominican Republic judge calls for Sen Robert Menendez to appear in court as charges and countercharges fly over veracity of allegations that Menendez patronized prostitutes in that country; Dominican lawyer Miguel Galvan files sworn affidavit saying he had enlisted the women to participate in interviews and that it had been staged.

byline.contributor: Jean Michel Caroit contributed reporting from La Romana, Dominican Republic.

lead_paragraph: Charges and countercharges flew over the veracity of allegations that Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey had patronized prostitutes in the Dominican Republic.

headline.seo: Dominican Judge Orders Menendez to Appear in Court
headline.main: Dominican Judge Calls for Menendez to Appear at a Court Hearing
headline.print_headline: Dominican Judge Calls for Menendez and a Campaign Donor to Appear in Court
